member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.Dispose
member.summary: Closes the storage and clears memory used by the instance

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.Commit
member.summary: When using TransactionLog, this method commits the changes in the current instance to the output file and truncates the log. For all other cases the method is a no-op and no exception is raised. This method is NOT thread safe UNLESS the CallLevelLock property has been set to valid reader/writer lock. If you need to call this method while writers are currently accessing the tree, make sure the CallLevelLock options is specified.

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.Rollback
member.summary: With version 2 storage this will revert the contents of tree to it's initial state when the file was first opened, or to the state captured with the last call to commit. Any transaction log data will be truncated.
member.exception: Raised when called for a BPlusTree that is not using v2 files

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.EnableCount
member.summary: Due to the cost of upkeep, this must be enable each time the object is created via a call to EnableCount() which itself must be done before any writer threads are active for it to be accurate. This requires that the entire tree be loaded (sequentially) in order to build the initial working count. Once completed, members like Add() and Remove() will keep the initial count accurate.

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.UnloadCache
member.summary: Safely removes all items from the in-memory cache.

member.summary: Gets the value associated with the specified key.

The new value for the key if found.

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.TryUpdate(`0,`1,`1)
member.summary: Updates an element with the provided key to the value if it exists.
member.returns: Returns true if the key provided was found and updated to the value.
member.param: The object to use as the key of the element to update.
The new value for the key if found.
The value that is compared to the value of the element with key.

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.TryUpdate(`0,CSharpTest.Net.Collections.KeyValueUpdate{`0,`1})
member.summary: Modify the value associated with the result of the provided update method as an atomic operation, Allows for reading/writing a single record within the tree lock. Be cautious about the behavior and performance of the code provided as it can cause a dead-lock to occur. If the method returns an instance who .Equals the original, no update is applied.

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.Validate
member.summary: Forces a top-down, depth-first, crawl of the entire tree in which every node and every link or key is checked for accuracy. Throws on error.

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.EnumerateFile(CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTreeOptions{`0,`1})
member.summary: Directly enumerates the contents of BPlusTree from disk in read-only mode.
member.param: The options normally used to create the instance
member.returns: Yields the Key/Value pairs found in the file

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.RecoverFile(CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree{`0,`1}.Options)
member.summary: Recovers as much file content as possible into a newly created , if the operation returns a non-zero result it was successful and the file has been replaced with a new database containing the recovered data. The original file remains in-tact but was renamed with a '.deleted' extension.
member.remarks: If an exception occurs during the parsing of the file and one or more records were recovered, they will be stored in a file by the same name with an added extension of '.recovered'. This recovered file can be opened as a normal to view it's contents. During the restore it is possible that a single Key was found multiple times, in this case the first occurrence found will be used.
member.param: The options normally used to create the instance
member.returns: Returns 0 on failure, or the number of records successfully retrieved from the original file

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.RecoveryScan(CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree{`0,`1}.Options,System.IO.FileShare)
member.summary: Performs a low-level scan of the storage file to yield all Key/Value pairs it was able to read from the file.
member.param: The options normally used to create the instance
options used to open the file
member.returns: Yields the Key/Value pairs found in the file

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.BulkInsert(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Collections.Generic.KeyValuePair{`0,`1}})
member.summary: Rewrite the entire BTree as a transaction to include the provided items. This method is Thread safe. If the input is already sorted, use BulkInsertOptions overload to specify InputIsSorted = true.

member.summary: Rewrite the entire BTree as a transaction to include the provided items. This method is Thread safe. If the input is already sorted, use BulkInsertOptions overload to specify InputIsSorted = true.

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.EnumerateNodeContents(CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree{`0,`1}.NodePin)
member.summary: Exclusive access, deep-locking enumeration for bulk-insert, essentially this enumerates while at the same time it chases existing writers out of the tree.

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.CallLevelLock
member.summary: Defines the lock used to provide tree-level exclusive operations. This should be set at the time of construction, or not at all since operations depending on this (Clear, EnableCount, and UnloadCache) may behave poorly if operations that started prior to setting this value are still being processed. Out of the locks I've tested the ReaderWriterLocking implementation performs best here since it is a highly read-intensive lock. All public APIs that access tree content will aquire this lock as a reader except the tree exclusive operations. This also allows you, by way of aquiring a write lock, to gain exclusive access and perform mass updates, atomic enumeration, etc.

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.Count
member.summary: See comments on EnableCount() for usage of this property

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.LockTimeout
member.summary: Returns the lock timeout being used by this instance.

member.summary: Returns the version this option set is compatable with.

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTreeOptions`2.StorageType
member.summary: Can be used to explicitly specify the storage type, or by simply providing a file name this will be done for you. If no file name was specified the default is to use a memory store.

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTreeOptions`2.ReadOnly
member.summary: Sets the BTree into a read-only mode (only supported when opening an existing file)

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTreeOptions`2.StorageSystem
member.summary: Sets the custom implementation of the storage back-end to use for the BTree

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTreeOptions`2.FileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the FileName that should be used to store the BTree

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTreeOptions`2.CreateFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the file-create policy used when backing with a file storage

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTreeOptions`2.FileBlockSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of bytes per file-block used in the file storage

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTreeOptions`2.LockTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of milliseconds to wait before failing a lock request, the default of two minutes should be more than adequate.

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTreeOptions`2.LockingFactory
member.summary: Gets or sets the locking factory to use for accessing shared data. The default is WriterOnlyLocking() which does not perform read locks, rather it will rely on the cache of the btree and may preform dirty reads. You can use any implementation of ILockFactory; however, the SimpleReadWriteLocking seems to perform the most efficiently for both reader/writer locks. Additionally wrapping that instance in a ReserveredWriterLocking() instance will allow reads to continue up until a writer begins the commit process. If you are only accessing the BTree instance from a single thread this can be set to IgnoreLocking. Be careful of using ReaderWriterLocking as the write-intesive nature of the BTree will suffer extreme performance penalties with this lock.

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTreeOptions`2.CallLevelLock
member.summary: Defines a reader/writer lock that used to control exclusive tree access when needed. The public methods for EnableCount(), Clear(), and UnloadCache() each acquire an exclusive (write) lock while all other public methods acquire a shared (read) lock. By default this lock is non-operational (an instance of IgnoreLocking) so if you need the above methods to work while multiple threads are accessing the tree, or if you exclusive access to the tree, specify a lock instance. Since this lock is primarily a read-heavy lock consider using the ReaderWriterLocking or SimpleReadWriteLocking.

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTreeOptions`2.BTreeOrder
member.summary: A quick means of setting all the min/max values for the node counts using this value as a basis for the Maximum fields and one-quarter of this value for Minimum fields provided the result is in range.

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTreeOptions`2.MinimumChildNodes
member.summary: The smallest number of child nodes that should be linked to before refactoring the tree to remove this node. In a 'normal' and/or purest B+Tree this is always half of max; however for performance reasons this B+Tree allow any value equal to or less than half of max but at least 2.
member.value: A number in the range of 2 to 128 that is at most half of MaximumChildNodes.

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTreeOptions`2.MaximumChildNodes
member.summary: The largest number of child nodes that should be linked to before refactoring the tree to split this node into two. This property has a side-effect on MinimumChildNodes to ensure that it continues to be at most half of MaximumChildNodes.
member.value: A number in the range of 4 to 256.

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTreeOptions`2.MinimumValueNodes
member.summary: The smallest number of values that should be contained in this node before refactoring the tree to remove this node. In a 'normal' and/or purest B+Tree this is always half of max; however for performance reasons this B+Tree allow any value equal to or less than half of max but at least 2.
member.value: A number in the range of 2 to 128 that is at most half of MaximumValueNodes.

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTreeOptions`2.MaximumValueNodes
member.summary: The largest number of values that should be contained in this node before refactoring the tree to split this node into two. This property has a side-effect on MinimumValueNodes to ensure that it continues to be at most half of MaximumValueNodes.
member.value: A number in the range of 4 to 256.

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTreeOptions`2.CachePolicy
member.summary: Determines how long loaded nodes stay in memory, Full keeps all loaded nodes alive and is the most efficient, The default Recent keeps recently visited nodes alive based on the CacheKeepAlive properties, and None does not cache the nodes at all but does maintain a cache of locks for each node visited.

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTreeOptions`2.CacheKeepAliveMinimumHistory
member.summary: Determins minimum number of recently visited nodes to keep alive in memory. This number defines the history size, not the number of distinct nodes. This number will always be kept reguardless of the timeout. Specify a value of 0 to allow the timeout to empty the cache.

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTreeOptions`2.CacheKeepAliveMaximumHistory
member.summary: Determins maximum number of recently visited nodes to keep alive in memory. This number defines the history size, not the number of distinct nodes. The ceiling is always respected reguardless of the timeout. Specify a value of 0 to disable history keep alive.

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTreeOptions`2.CacheKeepAliveTimeout
member.summary: If the cache contains more that CacheKeepAliveMinimumHistory items, this timeout will start to remove those items until the cache history is reduced to CacheKeepAliveMinimumHistory. It is important to know that the BPlusTree itself contains no theads and this timeout will not be respected if cache is not in use.

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTreeOptions`2.FillChildNodes
member.summary: The desired fill-size of node that contain children

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTreeOptions`2.FillValueNodes
member.summary: The desired fill-size of node that contain values

member.summary: Calculates default node-thresholds based upon the average number of bytes in key and value

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.OptionsV2.CalculateOrder(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates default node-thresholds based upon the average number of bytes in key and value

member.name: M:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.OptionsV2.CreateStorage
member.summary: Used to create the correct storage type

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.OptionsV2.CallLevelLock
member.summary: Defines a reader/writer lock that used to control exclusive tree access when needed. Version2 files using trasacation logs will use this to gain exclusive access to the tree during calls to Commit, Rollback, etc. The default is to use a SimpleReadWriteLocking class. If you are accessing the tree from a single thread, consider using the IgnoreLocking class for better performance.

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.OptionsV2.FileVersion
member.summary: Returns the version this option set is compatible with.

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.OptionsV2.StoragePerformance
member.summary: Returns the DurabilityProtection of the underlying storage to create.

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.OptionsV2.TransactionLogFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets a filename to write binary log files to.
member.remarks: This is just a short-hand way of setting the TransactionLog instance. For better performance at the risk of loosing a record or two, consider creating the TransactionLog instance with the FileOptions set to (FileOptions.WriteThrough | FileOptions.Asynchronous).

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.OptionsV2.TransactionLog
member.summary: Gets or sets an implementation of ITransactionLog<TKey, TValue> used to log writes to this tree for recovery and/or monitoring.

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.OptionsV2.ExistingLogAction
member.summary: Defines the action to perform when opening a BPlusTree with an existing log file.

member.name: P:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.OptionsV2.TransactionLogLimit
member.summary: Defines the number of bytes in the transaction log file before the BPlusTree will auto-commit and truncate the log. Values equal to or less than zero will not auto-commit (default).

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of streams that will be created for threads to write in the file store

member.summary: Provides base functionality of a node cache, not much exciting here

member.name: T:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.NodeCacheFull
member.summary: performs a perfect cache of the entire tree

member.name: T:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.NodeCacheNone
member.summary: performs a perfect cache of the entire tree

member.summary: For enumeration

member.name: T:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.BPlusTree`2.NodeCacheNormal
member.summary: This is the default cache type, uses weakreferences and the GC to collect unused nodes after they exit the ObjectKeepAlive containment policy.

member.name: T:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.StorageType
member.summary: Defines the storage type to use

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.StorageType.Memory
member.summary: Uses in-memory storage

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.StorageType.Disk
member.summary: Uses a file to store data, (Set by setting the FileName property)

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.StorageType.Custom
member.summary: Uses a custom data store, (Set by setting the StorageSystem property)

member.name: T:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.CreatePolicy
member.summary: Determines if the file specified should be created

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.CreatePolicy.Never
member.summary: Does not create a new file

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.CreatePolicy.Always
member.summary: Creates a new file even if one already exists

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.CreatePolicy.IfNeeded
member.summary: Creates a new file only if it does not exist

member.name: T:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.CachePolicy
member.summary: Determines the type of node caching used in the tree

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.CachePolicy.None
member.summary: Does not cache, allways loads from storage.

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.CachePolicy.All
member.summary: Keeps every loaded object in memory.

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.CachePolicy.Recent
member.summary: Keeps a history of objects in memory (see CacheKeepAliveXXX properties)

member.name: T:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.ExistingLogAction
member.summary: Defines the action to perform when opening a BPlusTree with an existing log file.

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.ExistingLogAction.Default
member.summary: Infers the default wether or not the data file was created. For newly created data files (CreatePolicy = Always, or IfNeeded and the file is missing) the default will be Truncate. When existing data files are opened the default will ReplayAndCommit.

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.ExistingLogAction.Ignore
member.summary: Ignore the existing entries in the log

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.ExistingLogAction.Replay
member.summary: Replay the log entries uncommitted

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.ExistingLogAction.ReplayAndCommit
member.summary: Replay the log entries and commit the changes to the store

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.ExistingLogAction.Truncate
member.summary: Ignore the existing entries and truncate the log

member.name: T:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.StoragePerformance
member.summary: Defines the levels of durability the store will try to achieve. 'Uncommitted changes' in the descriptions below refers to all changes made to the tree since the last call to CommitChanges() on the BPlusTree class.

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.StoragePerformance.Fastest
member.summary: (100k rps) Uncommitted changes will be lost, a crash durring commit may corrupt state.
member.remarks: No changes are committed until a call to Commit is made, durring the commit a partial write may corrupt the store.

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.StoragePerformance.LogFileInCache
member.summary: (30k rps) Uses a system-cached transaction log to recover uncommitted changes after a process crash.
member.remarks: Will not corrupt state; however, in a power outage or system failure it may loose some comitted records.

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.StoragePerformance.CommitToCache
member.summary: (8k rps) Every write will commit changes to the storage file immediately into system cache
member.remarks: May corrupt state and/or loose data in the event of a power outage

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.StoragePerformance.LogFileNoCache
member.summary: (2k rps) Uses a cache-writethrough transaction log to recover uncommitted changes after a power outage or system crash.
member.remarks: Complies with ACID durability requirements, can be expensive to recover from the log.

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.StoragePerformance.CommitToDisk
member.summary: (1k rps) Every write will commit changes to the storage file immediately bypassing system cache (Slowest/Safest)

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.StoragePerformance.Default
member.summary: Defaults to using a transaction log in system cache for best performance/durability.

member.name: T:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.FileVersion
member.summary: Determines the binary file format and backwards compatibility

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.FileVersion.Version1
member.summary: Version 1 compatable

member.name: F:CSharpTest.Net.Collections.FileVersion.Version2
member.summary: Version 2 compatable
